wikipedia_page.main: Charles Hay Frewen (25 May 1813 – 1 September 1878), known until 1837 as Charles Hay Frewen-Turner, was an English land-owner and Conservative Party politician. He sat in the House of Commons from 1846 to 1857 for East Sussex, and thereafter suffered a series of electoral defeats as he unsuccessfully challenged the political power of the Duke of Rutland in North Leicestershire.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1852 United Kingdom general election

response: He married in 1808 Eleanor Clark, sister of the writer and Parisian salon hostess Mary Mohl and daughter of Charles Clark of Westminster. Mary frequently stayed with the Frewen-Turners at their home in Cold Overton.Patrick Waddington, 'Mohl, Mary Elizabeth (1793–1883)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography (Oxford University Press, 2004); online edn, January 2007 Retrieved 5 February 2015 Their children included the future politicians Charles Frewen and Thomas Frewen Turner.
